vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 4397
vote.title: Motion to Waive CBA Murray Amdt. No. 4397; To increase funding for housing counseling resources.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 4388
vote.title: Motion to Table Durbin Amdt. No. 4388; To address the treatment of primary mortgages in bankruptcy, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Resolution
vote.title: S. Res. 501; A resolution honoring the sacrifice of the members of the United States Armed Forces who have been killed in Iraq and Afghanistan.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Upon Reconsideration Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to H.R. 3221; A bill to provide needed housing reform and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Concurrent Resolution
vote.title: S. Con. Res. 70 as Amended; An original concurrent resolution setting forth the congressional budget for the United States Government for fiscal year 2009 and including the appropriate budgetary levels for fiscal years 2008 and 2010 through 2013.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4299
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 4299; Expressing the sense of the Senate regarding the need for comprehensive legislation to legalize the importation of prescription drugs from highly industrialized countries with safe pharmaceutical infrastructures.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4245
vote.title: Biden Amdt. No. 4245; To restore full funding for the international affairs budget, in support of the reconstruction of Iraq and Afghanistan, nuclear nonproliferation, foreign assistance, fighting global AIDS, promoting sustainable development, and other efforts, with an offset.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4339
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 4339; To provide for a deficit-neutral reserve fund for providing an above the line Federal income tax deduction for individuals purchasing health insurance outside the workplace.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4233
vote.title: Allard Amdt. No. 4233; To require that legislation to reauthorize SCHIP include provisions codifying the unborn child regulation.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4379
vote.title: Boxer Amdt. No. 4379; To facilitate coverage of pregnant women in SCHIP.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4380
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 4380; To provide for a deficit-neutral reserve fund for transferring funding for Berkeley, CA earmarks to the Marine Corps.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4276
vote.title: Grassley Amdt. No. 4276 as Modified; To exempt from pay-as-you-go enforcement modifications to the individual alternative minimum tax (AMT) that prevent millions of additional taxpayers from having to pay the AMT.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4372
vote.title: Kyl Amdt. No. 4372; To protect small businesses, family ranches and farms from the Death Tax by providing a $5 million exemption, a low rate for smaller estates and a maximum rate no higher than 35%.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4378
vote.title: Landrieu Amdt. No. 4378; To protect family businesses and farmers without increasing our nation's debt by providing for an estate tax that sets the exemption at $5 million and the rate at 35 percent, with the benefits of the exemption recaptured for estates over $100 million, paid for by closing tax loopholes that allow offshore deferral of compensation and transactions entered into solely for the purpose of avoiding taxation.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 4347
vote.title: Motion to Waive C.B.A. DeMint Amdt No. 4347; To establish an earmark moratorium for fiscal year 2009.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4348
vote.title: Kyl Amdt. No. 4348; To provide certainty to taxpayers by extending expiring tax provisions such as the R&D Tax Credit that helps US companies innovate, combat pay exclusion for our soldiers in the field, the education deduction to make colleges more affordable and the alternative energy incentives to make the environment cleaner through the end of 2009.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 4313
vote.title: Motion to Waive C.B.A. Cornyn Amdt. No. 4313; To protect the family budget from runaway Government spending by increasing the number of Senators necessary to waive the PAYGO Point of Order from 60 to 100.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 4340
vote.title: Motion to Waive C.B.A. DeMint Amdt. No. 4340; To create a point of order against bills that would raise gasoline prices.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4335
vote.title: Ensign Amdt. No. 4335; To increase funding for the Department of Justice for the vigorous enforcement of a prohibition against taking minors across State lines in circumvention of laws requiring the involvement of parents in abortion decisions consistent with the Child Custody Protection Act, which passed the Senate by a bipartisan vote of 65-34, with an offset.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4368
vote.title: Boxer Amdt. No. 4368 as Modified; To increase funding for the Department of Justice for the vigorous enforcement of laws protecting children.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 4309
vote.title: Motion to Table Vitter Amdt. No. 4309; To create a reserve fund to ensure that Federal assistance does not go to sanctuary cities that ignore the immigration laws of the United States and create safe havens for illegal aliens and potential terrorists.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4197
vote.title: Kohl Amdt. No. 4197; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund for a 3-year extension of the pilot program for national and State background checks on direct patient access employees of long-term care facilities or providers.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4284
vote.title: Brownback Amdt. No. 4284; To provide funds for a Commission on Budgetary Accountability and Review of Federal Agencies.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4232
vote.title: Allard Amdt. No. 4232; To pay down the Federal debt and eliminate government waste by reducing spending 5 percent on programs rated (as mandated under the Government Performance and Results Act (Public Law 103-62)) ineffective by the Office of Management and Budget Program Assessment Rating Tool.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4328
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 4328; To provide for a deficit-neutral reserve fund for Social Security reform.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4218
vote.title: Sanders Amdt. No. 4218; To put children ahead of millionaires and billionaires by restoring the pre-2001 top income tax rate for people earning over $1 million, and use this revenue to invest in LIHEAP; IDEA; Head Start; Child Care; nutrition; school construction and deficit reduction.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4240
vote.title: Ensign Amdt. No. 4240; To require wealthy Medicare beneficiaries to pay a greater share of their Medicare Part D premiums.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4246
vote.title: Allard Amdt. No. 4246; To raise taxes by an unprecedented $1.4 trillion for the purpose of fully funding 111 new or expanded federal spending programs.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 4242
vote.title: Motion to Waive C.B.A. Cornyn Amdt. No. 4242; To protect the family budget by providing for a budget point of order against legislation that increases income taxes on taxpayers, including hard-working middle-income families, entrepreneurs, and college students.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4231
vote.title: Sessions Amdt. No. 4231; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund for border security, immigration enforcement, and criminal alien removal programs.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4259
vote.title: Menendez Amdt. No. 4259; To establish a reserve fund for immigration reform and enforcement.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4222
vote.title: Alexander Amdt. No. 4222; To take $670,000 used by the EEOC in bringing actions against employers that require their employees to speak English, and instead use the money to teach English to adults through the Department of Education's English Literacy/Civics Education State Grant program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4350
vote.title: Kennedy Amdt. No. 4350; To increase funding for the Department of Education's English Literacy-Civics Education State Grant program, with an offset.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4207
vote.title: Alexander Amdt. No. 4207 as Modified; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to improve energy efficiency and production.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4329
vote.title: Bill Nelson Amdt. No. 4329; To establish a deficit-neutral reserve fund to improve energy efficiency and production.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4198
vote.title: Dorgan Amdt. No. 4198; To increase the Indian Health Service by $1 billion in FY 2009.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4203
vote.title: Specter Amdt. No. 4203; To increase funding for the National Institutes of Health and the Low Income Home Energy Assistance Program.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4192
vote.title: Bunning Amdt. No. 4192 as Modified; To repeal the tax increase on Social Security benefits imposed by the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4204
vote.title: Conrad Amdt. No. 4204; To add a deficit-neutral reserve fund for repealing the 1993 increase in the income tax on Social Security benefits.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4191
vote.title: Kyl Amdt. No. 4191; To protect small businesses, family ranches and farms from the Death Tax by providing a $5 million exemption, a low rate for smaller estates and a maximum rate no higher than 35%.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4196
vote.title: Salazar Amdt. No. 4196 as Modified; To reform the estate tax to avoid subjecting thousands of families, family businesses, and family farms and ranches to the estate tax.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4189
vote.title: Upon Reconsideration Specter Amdt. No. 4189; To repeal section 13203 of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 by restoring the Alternative Minimum Tax rates that had been in effect prior thereto.

vote.question: On the Motion to Reconsider S.Amdt. 4189
vote.title: Motion to Reconsider Amdt. No. 4189; To repeal section 13203 of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 by restoring the Alternative Minimum Tax rates that had been in effect prior thereto.

vote.question: On the Motion S.Amdt. 4189
vote.title: Motion to Table Motion to Reconsider; To repeal section 13203 of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 by restoring the Alternative Minimum Tax rates that had been in effect prior thereto.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4189
vote.title: Specter Amdt. No. 4189; To repeal section 13203 of the Omnibus Budget Reconciliation Act of 1993 by restoring the Alternative Minimum Tax rates that had been in effect prior thereto.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4190
vote.title: Conrad Amdt. No. 4190; To add a deficit-neutral reserve fund for repealing the 1993 rate increase for the alternative minimum tax for individuals.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4170
vote.title: Graham Amdt. No. 4170 as Modified; To protect families, family farms and small businesses by extending the income tax rate structure, raising the death tax exemption to $5 million and reducing the maximum death tax rate to no more than 35%; to keep education affordable by extending the college tuition deduction; and to protect senior citizens from higher taxes on their retirement income, maintain U.S. financial market competitiveness, and promote economic growth by extending the lower tax rates on dividends and capital gains.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4160
vote.title: Baucus Amdt. No. 4160; To provide tax relief to middle-class families and small businesses, property tax relief to homeowners, relief to those whose homes were damaged or destroyed by Hurricanes Katrina and Rita, and tax relief to America's troops and veterans.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R. 4040 As Amended ; A bill to establish consumer product safety standards and other safety requirements for children's products and to reauthorize and modernize the Consumer Product Safety Commission.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 4097
vote.title: Motion To Table Vitter Amdt. No. 4097; To allow the prevailing party in certain civil actions related to consumer product safety rules to recover attorney fees.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 4094
vote.title: Motion To Table Cornyn Amdt. No. 4094 As Modified Further; To prohibit State attorneys general from entering into contingency fee agreements for legal or expert witness services in certain civil actions relating to Federal consumer product safety rules, regulations, standards, certification or labeling requirements, or orders.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4105
vote.title: Klobuchar Amdt. No. 4105 As Modified; To authorize appropriations for necessary or appropriate travel, subsistence, and related expenses, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Motion to Table S.Amdt. 4095
vote.title: Motion To Table DeMint Amdt. No. 4095; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S. 2663; A bill to reform the Consumer Product Safety Commission to provide greater protection for children's products, to improve the screening of noncompliant consumer products, to improve the effectiveness of consumer product recall programs, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to H.R.3221; A bill to provide needed housing reform and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S. 2634; A bill to require a report setting forth the global strategy of the United States to combat and defeat al Qaeda and its affiliates.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Motion to Proceed to Consider S. 2633; A bill to provide for the safe redeployment of United States troops from Iraq.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S.1200 as Amended; A bill to amend the Indian Health Care Improvement Act to revise and extend the Act.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3897
vote.title: Smith Amdt. No. 3897; To modify a provision relating to development of innovative approaches.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3896
vote.title: Vitter Amdt. No. 3896; To modify a section relating to limitation on use of funds appropriated to the Service.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4070
vote.title: DeMint Amdt. No. 4070; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion S.Amdt. 3899
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on the Dorgan Amdt. No. 3899; In the nature of a substitute.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4032
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 4032; To protect rape and sexual assault victims from HIV/AIDS and other sexually transmitted diseases.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4036
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 4036; To prioritize scarce resources to basic medical services for Indians.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4034
vote.title: Coburn Amdt. No. 4034; To allow tribal members to make their own health care choices.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4082
vote.title: Dorgan Amdt. No. 4082; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4020
vote.title: Tester Amdt. No. 4020; To express the sense of Congress regarding law enforcement and methamphetamine issues in Indian country.

vote.question: On the Conference Report
vote.title: HR 2082 Conference Report ; A bill to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2008 for intelligence and intelligence-related activities of the United States Government, the Community Management Account, and the Central Intelligence Agency Retirement and Disability System, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: S.2248 as Amended; An original bill to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978, to modernize and streamline the provisions of that Act, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Cloture Motion
vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture Re. S. 2248; An original bill to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978, to modernize and streamline the provisions of that Act, and for other purposes.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3919
vote.title: Feinstein Amdt. No. 3919; To provide for the review of certifications by the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3927
vote.title: Specter Amdt. No. 3927; To provide for the substitution of the United States in certain civil actions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3912
vote.title: Feingold Amdt. No. 3912; To modify the requirements for certifications made prior to the initiation of certain acquisitions.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3907
vote.title: Dodd Amdt. No. 3907; To strike the provisions providing immunity from civil liability to electronic communication service providers for certain assistance provided to the Government.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3979
vote.title: Feingold Amdt. No. 3979; To provide safeguards for communications involving persons inside the United States.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3910
vote.title: Feinstein Amdt. No. 3910; To provide a statement of the exclusive means by which electronic surveillance and interception of certain communications may be conducted.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3913
vote.title: Feingold Amdt. No. 3913; To prohibit reverse targeting and protect the rights of Americans who are communicating with people abroad.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3915
vote.title: Feingold Amdt. No. 3915 ; To place flexible limits on the use of information obtained using unlawful procedures.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 4010
vote.title: Reid Amdt. No. 4010; To revise the eligibility criteria for the 2008 recovery rebates for individuals.

vote.title: Motion To Invoke Cloture On The Reid Amdt No. 3983; Of a perfecting nature.

vote.question: On the Amendment S.Amdt. 3930
vote.title: Cardin Amdt No. 3930; To modify the sunset provision.

vote.title: Motion to Instruct Sgt. At Arms; A bill to provide economic stimulus through recovery rebates to individuals, incentives for business investment, and an increase in conforming and FHA loan limits.

vote.title: Motion To Invoke Cloture On The Motion To Proceed To Consider H.R. 5140; A bill to provide economic stimulus through recovery rebates to individuals, incentives for business investment, and an increase in conforming and FHA loan limits.

vote.title: Motion to Invoke Cloture on Amdt. No. 3918 to S. 2248; Relative to the extension of the Protect America Act of 2007.

vote.question: On Passage of the Bill
vote.title: H.R.4986; A bill to provide for the enactment of the National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2008, as previously enrolled, with certain modifications to address the foreign sovereign immunities provisions of title 28, United States Code, with respect to the attachment of property in certain judgements against Iraq, the lapse of statutory authorities for the payment of bonuses, special pays, and similar benefits for members of the uniformed services, and for other purposes.
